normalised: What's the deal with all these different numbers you need for healthcare in India? It's honestly confusing! Let me tell you about my recent experience.

So, my grandfather, Dadaji, recently had to be admitted to Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai. He's a senior citizen, so naturally, there was a stack of paperwork. One of the first things they asked for was his P-M-J-A-Y I-D. Now, thankfully, he's enrolled in the Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana, so we had that handy. It's a twelve-digit number, looked something like this: two eight one four hyphen seven five nine two hyphen three one six zero. I had actually helped him get this when the P-M-J-A-Y scheme was first launched.

normalised: But then came the insurance part. He's also got a private health insurance policy from I-C-I-C-I Lombard. Finding that policy number was another treasure hunt! It was a long alphanumeric string, something like I-L-H-L zero zero zero zero zero four seven eight nine six five four. I swear, I had to squint at the tiny font on his policy document to make sure I was copying it correctly. The hospital billing clerk kept telling me, "Sir, enter it correctly, otherwise claim will get rejected".
